com.siemens.mp.io
Interface ConnectionListener

public interface ConnectionListener

The ConnectionListener interface defines the capabilities for the connection's incoming data receiver. When the user wants to receive data on a connection, an implementation class for the ConnectionListener interface must first be created first. The receiveData method of this class must contain the incoming data processing code. After connection opening, this class instance is to be passed as a parameter to the Connection.setListener method call. After that, the receiveData method will be called by the runtime system each time incoming data from the given connection arrives.

See Also:
Connection

Example

Method Summary
 void receiveData(byte[] data)
          The callback method, which will be called by the runtime system each time incoming data arrive from the connection, if an implementation class object is registered as listener for that connection.
 

Method Detail

receiveData

public void receiveData(byte[] data)
The callback method, which will be called by the runtime system each time incoming data arrive from the connection, if an implementation class object is registered as listener for that connection. While implementing a class for the ConnectionListener interface, the user can place the code for incoming data processing into this method.

Parameters:
data - a bytearray containing the data received
See Also:
Connection, Connection.setListener, Connection.send

Example
